docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., July 11 -- One hundred and five more trials of participants in the anti-Communist revolution of 1956 will be held, or are being held in Budapest now, the United Nations Special Committee on Hungary reported today.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., July 11 -- One hundred and five more trials of participants in the anti-Communist revolution of 1956 will be held, or are being held in Budapest now, the United Nations Special Committee on Hungary reported today.
docs.abstract: UN com repts 105 trials set or in progress; chmn Andersen comments; cites Obersovszky case; repts only US has furnished data

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 11 -- Brazil's exporters have not yet thought of shipping coals to Newcastle, but they are selling red wines to France, sewing machines and electrical equipment to the United States, sugar to Communist China and petroleum to...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 11 -- Brazil's exporters have not yet thought of shipping coals to Newcastle, but they are selling red wines to France, sewing machines and electrical equipment to the United States, sugar to Communist China and petroleum to Western Europe.
docs.abstract: efforts to expand export of items formerly imported discussed

headline.main: BRAZIL EXPORTING FORMER IMPORTS; Sells Some Wine to France, Oil to Europe and Sewing Machines to U. S.

docs.snippet: MINNEAPOLIS, July 13 (UPI) -- Patty Berg fired her fourth straight sub-par round, a 72, for a 72-hole total of 288 and a victory in the $7,500 American women's open golf tournament at the Brookview Country Club today.
docs.lead_paragraph: MINNEAPOLIS, July 13 (UPI) -- Patty Berg fired her fourth straight sub-par round, a 72, for a 72-hole total of 288 and a victory in the $7,500 American women's open golf tournament at the Brookview Country Club today.

headline.main: PATTY BERG'S 288 TAKES OPEN TEST; She Scores at Minneapolis With a Final 72 -- Miss Suggs Is Runner-Up

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., July 16 -- The United Nations Special Committee on Hungary sharply accused the Budapest Government today of violating the United Nations Charter and the Declaration of Human Rights by the continued trials and executions of...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., July 16 -- The United Nations Special Committee on Hungary sharply accused the Budapest Government today of violating the United Nations Charter and the Declaration of Human Rights by the continued trials and executions of participants in the 1956 anti-Soviet revolt.
docs.abstract: UN Special Com charges trials and executions of '56 rebels violate UN Charter and Human Rights Declaration; scores USSR and Rumania for disregarding UN bids for data; implies Kadar regime acted in bad faith by trying Nagy and assocs despite recent assurances that such trials were over; queries continued presence of USSR troops; Amb Lodge hails rept

headline.main: New Hungary Trials Scored by U. N. Unit; HUNGARY ACCUSED BY U. N. UNIT ANEW
